title: Find input value
text: When we know an output value and want to determine the input values that would produce that output value, we set the output equal to the function's formula and solve for the input.

title: Substitution
text: Substitute $$h(p)=3$$ into the original $$h(p)=p^2+2p$$, and we get the equation $$3=p^2+2p$$, which we are going to solve next.

title: Factorization
text: To solve $$3=p^2+2p$$, we can start by moving 3 to the other side: $$p^2+2p-3=0$$. We can now factor the expression into $$\left(p+3\right) \left(p-1\right)=0$$.

title: Solving Equations
text: Solve the equation $$\left(p+3\right) \left(p-1\right)=0$$. What is p?
